events.title: Kintsugi Hope wellbeing course (evening)
events.content:
Evening version of the 10-week Kintsugi Hope wellbeing course.
This is the beginning of a supportive 10-week journey designed to help participants develop resilience and wellbeing skills. The course provides practical tools and strategies for managing life’s challenges in a safe, welcoming environment.
Evening sessions available for those who cannot attend the daytime course.

events.title: Kintsugi Hope wellbeing course (daytime)
events.content:
Start of a 10-week Kintsugi Hope course helping people handle stress, worries, relationships and the pressures of modern life.
This is the beginning of a supportive 10-week journey designed to help participants develop resilience and wellbeing skills. The course provides practical tools and strategies for managing life’s challenges in a safe, welcoming environment.

events.title: Blue Christmas
events.content:
A reflective service of comfort & hope Blue Christmas is a reflective service of comfort & hope for anyone facing a difficult Christmas.
Please join us for a quiet candlelit service of reflection, prayer, silence & music.
Everyone is welcome.
Contact: office@oww.church | T: 01256 782724
An online service will be available on the St Leonard’s Oakley YouTube channel.
Find the link at www.stleonards-church.co.uk

events.title: Advent Gallery
events.content:
Community Gallery Event St Leonard’s is thrilled to host a community gallery event exploring Advent themes of light | hope | presence.
We warmly invite contributions from local artists of any age or ability to our first ever St Leonard’s Advent Gallery event.
When: From 7pm on Thursday 18th Dec at the St Leonard’s Centre
Any medium is welcome ‚Äì paintings, photography, sculpture, textiles, music, poetry, and more.
All contributions must be submitted by Sunday 14th Dec.
To submit your artwork or for more information, please contact Revd Ben Kautzer (ben@oww.church).
“A thrill of hope, the weary world rejoices
for yonder breaks a new and glorious morn.”
“The light shines in the darkness
and the darkness has not overcome it.”

events.title: Candlelit Carol Service
events.content:
Traditional Candlelit Carol Service Join us for a beautiful candlelit carol service at St Leonard’s Church, Oakley.
The service will be followed by mulled wine and mince pies.
Date: Sunday 14 December 2025
Time: 7:00pm
Venue: St Leonard’s Church, Oakley
Everyone is welcome to this special Christmas celebration.

events.title: Christingle
events.content:
Christingle Services Let the Light Shine!
Start the season with a festive service celebrating the true meaning of Christmas!
Service Times 3:00-3:30pm - A Mini-Christingle for the little ones
4:30-5:30pm - The BIG Christingle for everyone
Date: Sunday 7th December 2025
Venue: St Leonard’s, Oakley
Address: Rectory Road | RG23 7ED
Join us for these special Christingle services as we celebrate the light of Christ coming into the world.

events.content:

The brewery for the Barley Mow has decided to start refurbishment work in the garden marquee this week, so the garden marquee had to be taken down.

events.title: K-Pop Demon Hunters Kids Outdoor Movie Night
Oakley Ramblers Walk
events.content: This walk will be an 8-mile circular walk from Rooksdown to The Vyne, Sherborne St John and back. This is an easy walk with good paths, 1 field with 2 small horses, and a short section of road.¬†Care to be taken crossing the Tadley to Basingstoke road at the Ambulance Station and on the return.

events.title: SEND Families Social
events.content: Join us for a relaxed and friendly evening at your local pub, where SEND (Special Educational Needs and Disabilities) parents and carers can come together, connect, and unwind. Whether you’re looking to share experiences, build new friendships, or just enjoy a well-earned break, this is your chance to meet others who truly understand.

events.title: The Bereavement Journey
events.content:
The Bereavement Journey ‚Äì a place to talk Grief is hard.
Death can impact all of life.
7 Sessions of films and discussion for anyone bereaved anytime
Topics include: ‚Ä¢ Attachment, separation and loss ‚Ä¢ The pain and responses of grief ‚Ä¢ Anger and guilt ‚Ä¢ Coping with others‚Äô reactions ‚Ä¢ Delayed and suppressed grief ‚Ä¢ Adjusting to change ‚Ä¢ Moving forward healthily ‚Ä¢ Faith questions ‚Äì a Christian perspective (optional)
To find out more visit: thebereavementjourney.org
For more info or to book a place, please contact Penny Brown office@oww.church 01256 782724

events.content:

events.title: What's on, where?
events.content:
Did you realise how much there is going on in your Oakley?
There so many amazing venues/ groups/ organisations and events available to enjoy, like-minded, local people to meet and have fun with.
INFORMATION AND OPEN EVENT
--
Andover Hall, The Green Hut, The Methodist Church and St Leonards centre are opening their doors to demonstrate their facilities and help you find out what is happening .. right here under your nose!
Come and meet the people and organisations meeting and having fun in Oakley
--
Andover Hall - Andover Road, RG23 7HA (Junction of Andover Road & Station Road)
St Leonards Centre - Rectory Road, RG23 7HR (Junction of Station Road & Rectory Road)
The Green Hut - 74 Hill Road, RG23 7JJ
The Methodist Church - Hill Road, RG23 7HR (By the pond)

events.title: Annual Six-A-Side Football Tournament
events.content:
‚öΩÔ∏è üèÜ ü•≥ Residents of Oakley. üëã üì£ It‚Äôs that time of year again!
This bank holiday weekend, 3000+ people will flock to the Peter Houseman Playing Fields for the annual Oakley FC Six-A-Side Football Tournament. ‚öΩÔ∏è
Over 150 teams, U7-U16, proper fun grassroots football, fast and furious short matches. Come & watch, have a bite to eat and a mingle, bump into people you know. üòä ¬£2.50 entry, kids go free. It‚Äôs a fabulous community event with a great atmosphere, raising money for the club and for local cancer charity Sebastian‚Äôs Action Trust. ü§ó
üöô üöó üöô Please PLEASE (as always) expect traffic congestion on Oakley Lane on both Saturday and Sunday, especially around the school and shops. üöô üöó üöô
Car parking is in the school grounds and the access is one way / single file, so please be patient! üôè Our parking stewards üòá üòá üòá will be doing their very best to avoid gridlock, however it is likely to be busy both days between 7.45-9am ‚Ä¶ and the am-to-pm changeover of 12-2.30pm will be the busiest time by far ‚Äì we advise going the long way round the village. üîÑ
NB: Peter Houseman field itself is not open for public use this weekend ‚õîÔ∏è and is disabled parking and access only.
On the Tournify app (link below) you can find all the groups, timings and results updated in real time. All our burgers üçî and sausages üå≠ come from Wally‚Äôs V&B Butchers, we are supported by a number of local businesses, and teams come to play from all over Basingstoke and Hampshire, Berkshire, Surrey and Wiltshire.
So, may the best teams win! ü•á Good luck to all our Oakley players! üòâü§û‚òòÔ∏è We hope everyone has a splendid couple of days! ü•≥
Thank you in advance for your patience about traffic congestion or disruption. üöô üöó üöô
We really appreciate all your support. üòä ‚Äì on behalf of Oakley FC. ‚öΩÔ∏è
https://www.tournify.uk/live/ofc2025/
